TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Utf8JsonWriter : IAsyncDisposable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Utf8JsonWriter extends System.Object implements class System.IAsyncDisposable, class System.IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class Utf8JsonWriter Implements IAsyncDisposable, IDisposable
public ref class Utf8JsonWriter sealed : IAsyncDisposable, IDisposable
type Utf8JsonWriter = class interface IDisposable interface IAsyncDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides a high-performance API for forward-only, non-cached writing of UTF-8 encoded JSON text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
`Utf8JsonWriter` writes the text sequentially with no caching and by default adheres to the [JSON RFC](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259), with the exception of writing comments.
A method that attempts to write invalid JSON when validation is enabled throws a <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> with a context-specific error message. Since this type is a ref struct, it does not directly support async. However, it does provide support for reentrancy to write partial data and to continue writing in chunks. To be able to format the output with indentation and white space OR to skip validation, create an instance of <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterState> and pass that in to the writer.

Docs.summary: Gets the depth of the current token.
Docs.value: The depth of the current token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `CurrentDepth` property tracks the recursive depth of the nested objects / arrays within the JSON text written so far.

Docs.param: The value to be written as a JSON string as an element of a JSON array.
Docs.summary: Writes the value (as a JSON string) as an element of a JSON array.
Docs.remarks: Writes the using the round-trippable ('O') . For example, 2017-06-12T05:30:45.7680000.
Docs.exception: The JSON data to be written would be invalid JSON (while validation is enabled).

Docs.param: The value to be written as a JSON string as an element of a JSON array.
Docs.summary: Writes the value (as a JSON string) as an element of a JSON array.
Docs.remarks: Writes the using the round-trippable ('O') . For example, 2017-06-12T05:30:45.7680000-07:00.
Docs.exception: The JSON data to be written would be invalid JSON (while validation is enabled).

Docs.param: The value to be written as a JSON string as an element of a JSON array.
Docs.summary: Writes the value (as a JSON string) as an element of a JSON array.
Docs.remarks: Writes the using the default (that is, 'D'), as the form: nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn.
Docs.exception: The JSON data to be written would be invalid JSON (while validation is enabled).
